article.headline: Miami 59, Villanova 56
article.story: VILLANOVA, Pa. (AP) -- Darius Rice scored 20 points, helping Miami snap a 10-game losing streak in a 59-56 win over Villanova on Tuesday night. Gary Hamilton and Armondo Surratt added 10 points for the Hurricanes (14-15, 4-11 Big East). Allan Ray scored 27 points and Mike Nardi had 14 for the Wildcats (14-14, 6-9), who have lost four in a row and are in danger of missing out on an NIT bid. Villanova, which lost in overtime to Connecticut last week, finishes the season Saturday at No. 6 Pittsburgh. The Hurricanes went ahead for good with 2:23 left, taking a 57-54 lead on Surratt's 3-pointer. Rice, who scored 17 points in the second half, then added a jumper for a 59-54 lead. Ray sank a couple of free throws, but the Wildcats couldn't do anything else off a couple of Miami turnovers in the final minute. Villanova took an early lead after hitting three straight 3-pointers, one from Nardi and two each by Ray, taking an eight-point lead into halftime before Miami began chipping away. The Hurricanes scored the first seven points of the second half to pull within one, then Ray hit a 3-pointer. Rice made it 43-41 after a 3, but Derrick Snowden followed with a basket. Rice got Miami within one again with another 3, only to have Nardi answer with one on the other end. Miami finally took a 52-51 lead when Rice hit a jumper with 4:28 to go. Villanova tied it at 54, then Surratt hit the winner. The Hurricanes shot 58 percent from the field in the second half. Villanova had 18 turnovers, wiping out a solid 47 percent shooting effort from the floor. Villanova seniors Andreas Bloch, Tom Grace and Derrick Snowden were honored before the game.
